CatDescriptText: Pat MacDonald, secretary of the Downtown office of the Chamber of Commerce, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 31, 1959, pg. 32 with question: "Do you believe in capital punishment? If so, do you  think that it should be imposed on convicted defendants under the age of 21?" answer reads: "For some crimes, I say yes.  For instance the two youths in Nebraska, you recall the girl and the boy who committed the many murders, well, I say in that case the death penalty was justified."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Pat MacDonald wearing light colored scarf, light colored leather coat, and light colored gloves, holding handbag over left arm and small paper bag in left hand, standing on street with pedestrians, automobiles, and buildings with signs, including one that reads "Restaura[nt]"
